label: Broker
info:
Broadcast messages received from any client to all clients. Note that
all properties other than `msg._session` and `msg.retain` are
transmitted directly from the publisher to all subscribers.

- Removes `msg._session` entirely, in the case of initially published
  messages.

- Handles `msg.topic` and `msg.retain` in a fashion inspired by MQTT.

If a client publishes a message with `msg.retain` set to `true`, the
`retain` function node saves a clone of the message in flow context
using a file-system backed context store using `msg.topic` as the key.
It then sets `msg.retain` to `false` before broadcasting the message
to subscribed clients.

Each time a client connects, the `retained` function node sends that
client all currently stored messages with `msg.retain` set to `true`.

Retained messages' contents can be updated by sending subsequent
messages with the same `msg.topic` and `msg.retain` set to `true`.

Retained messages can be deleted by sending subsequent messages with
the same `msg.topic`, `msg.retain` set to `true` and `msg.payload`
set to the empty string (`''`).

label: Timer
info:
Publish event messages, with `msg.topic` and `msg.payload` as described
below, each time the corresponding conditions occur.

These messages are sent each time flows start and then once per day
while the flow is running:

- `msg.topic` set to `daily/theme` with `msg.payload` set to one of
  the _theme_ values described below

- `msg.topic` set to `daily/sunrise` with `msg.payload` set to the
  timestamp for the time at which the sun rises on the current day

- `msg.topic` set to `daily/sunset` with `msg.payload` set to the
  timestamp for the time at which the sun sets on the current day

This message is sent at the same time the preceding daily events
and also each time a user changes the _bedtime_ setting:

- `msg.topic` set to `daily/bedtime` with `msg.payload` set to a
  randomly chosen timestamp as described below

This message is sent each time flows start and then up to five times
per day while the flow is running:

- `msg.topic` set to `timer/time` with `msg.payload` set to one of the
_time_ values described below

### Bedtime

The dashboard provides a means for a user to select a given hour
for "bedtime." The actual value for `daily/bedtime` event payloads
varies each day by adding a ranomly chosen offset of up to 30 minutes
before or after the hour selected by a user.

### Themes

The `msg.payload` for `daily/theme` is set to one of the following
strings based on the current date:

- `tribal` - July 1 - 4 (US Independence Day)
- `spooky` - any day in October
- `jolly` - any day in December
- `standard` - any other day

### Times

An event message with `msg.topic` set to `timer/time` is published
each time flows start and then at the start of each time range
corresponding to the following values for `msg.payload`. Note
that the rules are based on the sun's position each minute of each
day:

- `morning` - published when the sun's azimuth is from the east and
  its altitude is below the threshold for `midday` described below

- `midday` - published when the sun first reaches a particular altitude
  each day; note that `midday` events do not occur on certain days
  at certain latitudes

- `afternoon` - published when the sun's azimuth is from the west
  and its altitude is above the horizon but below the threshold for
  `midday`

- `evening` - published when the sun's altitude is below the horizon
  and the current time is earlier than the randomly chosen _bedtime_

- `night` - published when the sun's altitude is below the horizon
  and the current time is later than the randomly chosen _bedtime_

label: Automation
info:
Subscribe to timer and settings events which trigger automation.

Note that this is the one flow with hard-coded references to particular
device groups and scenes.

label: PowerView
info:
Interoperate with the PowerView hub whose IP address is specified by the
`${POWERVIEW_ADDRESS}` environment variable.

This flow obtains the current configuration data from the hub and
publishes an event message whose `msg.topic` is `powerview/model`
and whose `msg.payload` contains a JSON object with the structure
expected by the front-end code for the dashboard. It also subscribes
to `put/powerview/scene` messages and activates the PowerView scenes
indicated by their payloads.

label: Hue
info:
Interoperate with Philips Hue Bridges.

This flow:

- Uses mDNS to discover Hue bridges on the LAN and publishes
  corresponding `hue/bridges` event messages for use by the dashboard's
  front-end logic

- Contains two instances of the _Hue API V2_ subflow, one each for
  the Hue bridges specified by the `${GROUND_FLOOR_HUE_ADDRESS}` and
  `${BASEMENT_HUE_ADDRESS}` environment variables

info:
Synchronize receipt of `daily/timestamp` and `settings/bedtime`

name: theme
info:
Set `msg.payload` to one of the _theme_ values, described below, and
`msg.topic` to `daily/theme`.

_Note that this `function` node is placed downstream of a `join` in
order to delay sending MQTT messages until after the connection to the
broker has been established; the only input data on which this function
actually relies comes from the `inject` node which fires once when
flows start and then every morning at 1AM._

# Input

- timestamp in `msg.payload.daily`
- all other `msg` properties are ignored

# Output

- `msg.topic` set to `daily/theme`
- `msg.payload` set to one of the following strings, based on the
  the timestamp from the input:

| `msg.payload` | Description         |
|---------------|---------------------|
| `tribal`      | July 1 - 4          |
| `spooky`      | Any day in October  |
| `jolly`       | Any day in December |
| `standard`    | Any other day       |

name: bedtime
info:
Calculate a slightly randomized timestamp based on the values of
`msg.payload.daily` and `msg.payload.settings/bedtime` as described
below.

# Input
 
 - timestamp for the current day in `msg.payload.daily`
 - value from the `Bedtime` dashboard control in
   `msg.payload.settings/bedtime`
- all other `msg` properties are ignored

# Output

- `msg.topic` set to `daily/bedtime`
- `msg.payload` set to a timestamp as described below

# Details

This `function` node receives input from a `join` node that combines the
timestamp for a given day with a value selected by use of a dropdown
control on the dashboard. It calculates a random offset of plus or minus
30 minutes, adds that to the hour specified by the received value in
`msg.payload.settings/bedtime` and calculates the timestamp for that
hour on the day specified by the value received in `msg.payload.daily`,
placing it in `msg.payload` in the output message.

func: rbe
info:
Block messages unless `msg.payload` changes, treating each `msg.topic`
independently.

name: time

func: rbe
rbe

name: sunrise | sunset
info:
Use the [suncalc](https://www.npmjs.com/package/suncalc) package to
obtain the times at which the sun rises and sets on a given day.

_Note that this `function` node is placed downstream of a `join` in
order to delay sending MQTT messages until after the connection to the
broker has been established; the only input data on which this function
actually relies comes from the `inject` node which fires once when
flows start and then every morning at 1AM._

_Note also that this assumes:_

_- `function` nodes are allowed to dynamically load the_ suncalc
   _package_

_- `${LATITUDE}` and `${LONGITUDE}` environment variables contain the
  georgraphical coordinates to pass to `suncalc.getTimes()`_

# Input

- timestamp in `msg.payload.daily`
- all other `msg` properties are ignored

# Output

1. sunrise
   - `msg.payload` is the timestamp for sunrise as reported by _suncalc_
   - `msg.topic` is `daily/sunrise`
2. sunset
   - `msg.payload` is the timestamp for sunset as reported by _suncalc_
   - `msg.topic` is `daily/sunset`
